Description: Base sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery plate with ring foot; wholly glazed (interior fired reddish); incised ovolos around tondo.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Perhaps from a plate with rilled rim (see Agora XII 146-47, fig. 10, pl. 36), though could also come from a shallow bowl or stemless cup. [Hayes 1984 p. 41, no 68]
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1984 / Greek and Italian Black-Gloss Wares and Related Wares in the Royal Ontario Museum (p. 41, no. 68)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1908)
